input_text:
Job Title: Education Healthcare Recruiter

Location: South Carolina, United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Human Resources, Sales

Description:
Interested in furthering your career in sales and recruitment? Phaxis has 20+ years of experience within the staffing industry. To put it in perspective, we’ve helped our clients fill nearly 100,000 unique roles across industries ranging from Healthcare to Technology. Driven by our people, company culture, and winning mindset we are continuing to grow across the U.S. and more specifically our Travel Healthcare team.
In your first few months as an Education Healthcare Recruiter, you’ll be immersed in our training curriculum, apply your industry knowledge, and offer mentorship to those around you, while individually contributing.
Responsibilities  As an Education Healthcare Recruiter, you’ll be an expert in all things staffing and help make hiring easier for school systems across the US who have various healthcare staffing needs. Through conducting phone interviews, managing interview processes, and negotiating offers, you’ll help connect highly talented individuals to growing organizations, typically with school year length employment contracts.
Establish new candidate relationships over the phone and over videoIdentify and pipeline new technology candidates, manage information and follow up on a CRMScreen candidates over the phone and send qualified talent to companiesCoordinate and manage interview processes through offer negotiationMentor associate-level recruiters providing recruitment best practices
Qualifications People are at the heart of our company’s success and regardless of your education, we’re interested in hiring the best talent. More specifically, if you ideally have 2 years of education healthcare recruitment experience with your current team, along with a positive attitude we’d love to speak. Here are a few other qualifications we assess throughout the interview process:
Desire and ability to excel in a sales environmentGrit – ability to overcome challenges and learn from experiencesTenacity – ability to remain persistent and stay highly motivatedWinning Mindset – a track record of success in a competitive environmentCommunication Skills – ability to build rapport and translate information
Benefits & Compensation
We are proud to offer an industry-leading comprehensive compensation and wellness package. We believe in offering all our staff work flexibility as we’ve seen how life-changing this can be as well as having access to a wide variety of healthcare plans to help address everyone’s needs. Please don’t hesitate to speak with a member of Talent Acquisition on any questions you may have, but here are some highlights of our benefits and compensation package:
Competitive Annual Base Salary + Uncapped Commissions3 weeks of PTO, 15 Paid Holidays, 5 Sick Days (unlimited PTO year 3)401(k), Life Insurance, Healthcare, Dental and Vision options are availableAward-winning culture with monthly team events, semi-annual holiday parties, and an annual President’s ClubRelocation Opportunities across the USFully Remote Opportunity with company sponsored in-person training!
If interested in learning more about working at Phaxis, submit your application today.
Equal Employment Opportunity
Your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Phaxis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, and will not be discriminated against based on, race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, veteran status, disability, or other protected category.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
